result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan M Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Ryan M Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a brief adjournment for the plea and sentencing. Court grants. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until the next court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
filed, to be produced from Washington County Jail

Defendant Ryan M Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense attorney is requesting adjournment to get a new pre-trial offer from the state and requests the matter is set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant can be returned forthwith.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Washington County Jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed, to be produced from Washington County Jail

Defendant Ryan M Smith in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter to follow along with 15CM804 for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Be in contact with attorney and speak to her in person at least 1 time per week.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to comply with I.D.
